comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0b10) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b10
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0b10) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b10

On FF4b10 and my default profile, the buttons are in a strange order.
I have Firebug, which is the only extension in the module bar.
So, i see, in that order, (Firebug button), (resize corner), (close module bar).
All 3 are aligned to the left.
The resize grip works fine, as if it was in the right corner.

I'm not really sure when this happened because i don't use module bar a lot.
I'm sure it worked on beta7, probably on 9, and i think it appeared after the upgrade to beta10.

On my other profile, it works well.

I tried to customize the toolbar, but i can't move the resize or the firebug button, so it's useless.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Display module bar (...)
Actual Results:  
(Firebug button), (resize corner), (close module bar)

Expected Results:  
(close module bar) <space> (Firebug button), (resize corner) 

http://img17.imageshack.us/i/ff4bug1.png/
The bug is visible on the bottom window.
The red one is another profile, for comparison

comments.text:
Build ID: 
Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0b10) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b10

This is a WFM. Could you please create a new profile and then install firebug. 
Compare your result UI with the default profile. Does this fix your problem? 

http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/managing%20profiles

My guess is a firebug compatibility issue, that occured in that specific profile only. More to this, AMO states that firebug is currently incompatible with beta10. 

Have you forced compatibility in about:config to install firebug? 

Thanks
comments.raw_text:

Thanks
